channel.title: A keyboard macro
channel.description:
Let's say I want to move my mouse to a certain (x, y) when I press F12 whilst playing RS. Obviously, I'd want to use the robot class, but the problem arises that I cannot listen to keyboard events outside the application's focus - or am I wrong? I know you can create transparent applets, but would it be possible to send the keyboard/mouse-events through the window (to the underlying window containing the RS applet)?
How should I go about this?

item.title: A keyboard macro
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

abraham2119:

why would you use java for this

learning experience, i could always just use C++

Nueb35:

If its not intended to be a cross-platform thing, you can use JNI to listen for the keyboard

sort of what i was thinking i’d have to do

Read full topic

item.title: A keyboard macro
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Fsig, post:2, topic:427681”]You would need to load the client into your program before you can attach a key listener.

Discardex has a loader which you can easily implement into your macro, just needs to load a applet into your JFrame.[/quote]
I’m trying to avoid hacking the RS applet.

Read full topic

item.title: A keyboard macro
item.dc:creator: @Fsig Fsig
item.description:
@Fsig wrote:

You would need to load the client into your program before you can attach a key listener.

Discardex has a loader which you can easily implement into your macro, just needs to load a applet into your JFrame.

Read full topic
